# Platform: Flutter

## /
- [Readme](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/README.md): Developer README describing local example-app testing and the multi-package release workflow, including manual version/CHANGELOG updates across Flutter, Android, iOS, and platform_interface packages and the required `flutter pub publish` order.
- [License](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/LICENSE): Defines the project’s MIT license, outlining copyright ownership, redistribution/modification rights, warranty disclaimers, and liability limitations for all source code and associated documentation in this SDK.

## notifly_flutter_android/android/src/main/kotlin/tech/notifly/flutter
- [Notiflyflutterplugin](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_android/android/src/main/kotlin/tech/notifly/flutter/NotiflyFlutterPlugin.kt): Implements the Android side of the `notifly_flutter_android` MethodChannel, bridging Flutter method calls (initialize, user identity/properties, event tracking, log level, notification click listener) to the native `Notifly` SDK with coroutine-based async user ID retrieval and main-thread result dispatch.
- [Version](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_android/android/src/main/kotlin/tech/notifly/flutter/version.kt): Defines the `NOTIFLY_FLUTTER_PLUGIN_VERSION` constant used to expose and track the current Notifly Flutter Android plugin version (`2.0.
- [Notiflyserializer](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_android/android/src/main/kotlin/tech/notifly/flutter/NotiflySerializer.kt): Serializes `IPushNotification` and `INotificationClickEvent` instances from `tech.notifly.
- [Notiflyflutterplugin](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_android/android/src/main/kotlin/tech/notifly/flutter/NotiflyFlutterPlugin.kt): Implements the Android side of the Notifly Flutter plugin, exposing Notifly SDK APIs (initialize, user identity/properties, event tracking, log level, user id retrieval, notification click callbacks) over the `notifly_flutter_android` MethodChannel with main-thread marshalling and coroutine-backed async calls.
- [Version](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_android/android/src/main/kotlin/tech/notifly/flutter/version.kt): Defines the `NOTIFLY_FLUTTER_PLUGIN_VERSION` constant (currently "2.0.
- [Notiflyserializer](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_android/android/src/main/kotlin/tech/notifly/flutter/NotiflySerializer.kt): Provides static helpers to serialize `IPushNotification` and `INotificationClickEvent` objects from `tech.notifly.

## notifly_flutter_android/lib
- [Notifly Flutter Android](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_android/lib/notifly_flutter_android.dart): Android-specific `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` implementation that binds to the `'notifly_flutter_android'` `MethodChannel`, exposing `initialize`, `setLogLevel`, user identity/property setters, `trackEvent`, and `getNotiflyUserId` with error handling, plus `registerWith` to set this as the default platform.
- [Notifly Flutter Android](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_android/lib/notifly_flutter_android.dart): Android-specific `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` implementation that configures a `MethodChannel` (`notifly_flutter_android`) and forwards initialization, logging, user identity/properties, contact info, timezone, event tracking, and `getNotiflyUserId` calls to the native Android layer, with error handling and a `registerWith` entry point.

## notifly_flutter_android/test
- [Notifly Flutter Android Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_android/test/notifly_flutter_android_test.dart): Unit tests for `NotiflyFlutterAndroid` that register the Android implementation, mock its `MethodChannel` via `TestDefaultBinaryMessengerBinding`, and verify the `getPlatformName` method call flow and returned platform name.
- [Notifly Flutter Android Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_android/test/notifly_flutter_android_test.dart): Unit test suite for `NotiflyFlutterAndroid` verifying platform registration and `getPlatformName` behavior by wiring a mock `MethodChannel` handler via `TestDefaultBinaryMessengerBinding` and asserting correct `MethodCall` logging and `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` instance assignment.

## notifly_flutter_ios/ios/Classes
- [Notiflyflutterplugin](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_ios/ios/Classes/NotiflyFlutterPlugin.swift): Bridges Flutter method channel `"notifly_flutter_ios"` to the native `notifly_sdk`, handling initialization, user identity/properties (ID, email, phone, timezone), event tracking with optional JSON params, and exposing `getPlatformName`/`getNotiflyUserId`, with basic argument validation/logging.
- [Version](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_ios/ios/Classes/version.swift): Defines the `Constants` struct exposing the `SDK_VERSION` static string (`"2.0.
- [Notiflyflutterplugin](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_ios/ios/Classes/NotiflyFlutterPlugin.swift): Bridges the Flutter `notifly_flutter_ios` method channel to the native `notifly_sdk`, handling initialization, user identity/properties (ID, email, phone, timezone), event tracking (with optional JSON params and segmentation keys), and exposing `getNotiflyUserId`.
- [Version](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_ios/ios/Classes/version.swift): Defines the `Constants` struct exposing the SDK’s current semantic version via `SDK_VERSION`, enabling other iOS plugin classes to read and propagate the Flutter Notifly SDK version at build or runtime.

## notifly_flutter_ios/lib
- [Notifly Flutter Ios](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_ios/lib/notifly_flutter_ios.dart): iOS-specific `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` implementation that configures a `MethodChannel` (`notifly_flutter_ios`) to initialize Notifly, manage user identity/properties (ID, email, phone, timezone), track events (with JSON-encoded params/segment keys), fetch the Notifly user ID, and register as the platform instance.
- [Notifly Flutter Ios](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_ios/lib/notifly_flutter_ios.dart): iOS-specific `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` implementation that wires a `MethodChannel('notifly_flutter_ios')` to native code for initialization, user identity/properties (ID, email, phone, timezone), event tracking (JSON-encoded params/segmentation), platform name/user ID retrieval, and platform registration.

## notifly_flutter_ios/test
- [Notifly Flutter Ios Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_ios/test/notifly_flutter_ios_test.dart): Defines widget tests for `NotiflyFlutterIOS`, using a mock `MethodChannel` to verify plugin registration with `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` and the `getPlatformName` MethodCall contract/response on the iOS implementation.
- [Notifly Flutter Ios Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_ios/test/notifly_flutter_ios_test.dart): Unit tests for `NotiflyFlutterIOS` verifying plugin registration with `NotiflyFlutterPlatform`, mocking `MethodChannel` calls via `TestDefaultBinaryMessengerBinding`, and asserting `getPlatformName` invokes the expected method and returns the iOS platform name.

## notifly_flutter_platform_interface/lib
- [Notifly Flutter Platform Interface](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_platform_interface/lib/notifly_flutter_platform_interface.dart): Defines the `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` base class and singleton instance wiring for platform-specific Notifly implementations, exposing method-channel-backed APIs for initialization, user identity/properties, logging, event tracking, Notifly user ID retrieval, and web push permission via `PluginPlatformInterface`.
- [Notifly Flutter Platform Interface](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_platform_interface/lib/notifly_flutter_platform_interface.dart): Defines the abstract `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` interface and default `MethodChannel`-backed singleton for platform implementations, providing verified entrypoints for initialization, user identity/properties, logging, event tracking, Notifly user ID retrieval, and web push permission via `plugin_platform_interface`.

## notifly_flutter_platform_interface/lib/src
- [Method Channel Notifly Flutter](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_platform_interface/lib/src/method_channel_notifly_flutter.dart): Implements `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` using a `MethodChannel('notifly_flutter')` to bridge Dart to native Notifly APIs, exposing initialization, logging, user identity/properties, contact info, timezone, event tracking, user ID retrieval, and notification permission request methods.
- [Method Channel Notifly Flutter](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_platform_interface/lib/src/method_channel_notifly_flutter.dart): Implements `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` using a `MethodChannel('notifly_flutter')` to bridge Flutter to native Notifly APIs for initialization, configuration (log level, user identity/properties, contact info, timezone), event tracking, permission requests, and retrieving the Notifly user ID.

## notifly_flutter_platform_interface/test
- [Notifly Flutter Platform Interface Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_platform_interface/test/notifly_flutter_platform_interface_test.dart): Defines a mock `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` implementation and widget-test group that initializes the platform interface singleton and verifies `getPlatformName()` correctly returns the mocked platform name, ensuring the platform interface delegation works as expected.
- [Notifly Flutter Platform Interface Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_platform_interface/test/notifly_flutter_platform_interface_test.dart): Unit test suite that verifies `NotiflyFlutterPlatform`’s singleton `instance` can be overridden with a mock implementation and that the `getPlatformName()` API correctly returns the mock platform name using `flutter_test`’s widget test binding.

## notifly_flutter_platform_interface/test/src
- [Method Channel Notifly Flutter Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_platform_interface/test/src/method_channel_notifly_flutter_test.dart): Unit test verifying `MethodChannelNotiflyFlutter.getPlatformName` by mocking the `MethodChannel` via `TestDefaultBinaryMessenger`, capturing `MethodCall`s, and asserting the invoked method and returned platform name.
- [Method Channel Notifly Flutter Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_platform_interface/test/src/method_channel_notifly_flutter_test.dart): Unit test verifying `MethodChannelNotiflyFlutter.getPlatformName` by mocking the `MethodChannel` via `TestDefaultBinaryMessengerBinding`, capturing `MethodCall` invocations, and asserting the correct method name, arguments, and returned platform string.

## notifly_flutter_web/lib
- [Notifly Flutter Web](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_web/lib/notifly_flutter_web.dart): Web implementation of `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` that injects and initializes the Notifly JS SDK, exposes Flutter web bridges for user identity/attributes (`setUserId`, `setUserProperties`, `setEmail`, etc.), permission requests, event tracking, and registers via `registerWith`.
- [Constants](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_web/lib/constants.dart): Defines `Config` constants exposing the Flutter web SDK type, version, and underlying `notifly-js-sdk` dependency version for use across the package in runtime metadata, telemetry, and integration logic.
- [Notifly Flutter Web](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_web/lib/notifly_flutter_web.dart): Implements the web-specific `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` by dynamically loading the Notifly JavaScript SDK, exposing initialization and user/event APIs (`initialize`, `requestPermission`, `setUserId/Properties`, `setEmail`, `setPhoneNumber`, `setTimezone`, `trackEvent`) via JS interop, and registering as the web platform handler.
- [Constants](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter_web/lib/constants.dart): Defines the `Config` class exposing static constants for the Flutter web SDK type, SDK version, and underlying `notifly-js-sdk` dependency version, used across the package for versioning, diagnostics, and integration metadata.

## notifly_flutter/example/android/app/src/main/kotlin/com/example/notifly_flutter/example
- [Mainactivity](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/android/app/src/main/kotlin/com/example/notifly_flutter/example/MainActivity.kt): Android entry point for the Flutter example app, extending `FlutterActivity` to bootstrap the Flutter engine and UI for the `tech.notifly.
- [Mainactivity](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/android/app/src/main/kotlin/com/example/notifly_flutter/example/MainActivity.kt): Hosts the Flutter engine for the Android example app by extending `FlutterActivity`, serving as the primary Android entry point without adding custom platform logic or additional integrations.

## notifly_flutter/example/android/app/src/main/kotlin/package_name/example
- [Mainactivity](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/android/app/src/main/kotlin/package_name/example/MainActivity.kt): Android entrypoint Activity for the example Flutter app, extending `FlutterActivity` to bootstrap the Flutter engine and host the Dart runtime without adding any custom lifecycle, plugin, or platform-channel logic.
- [Mainactivity](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/android/app/src/main/kotlin/package_name/example/MainActivity.kt): Defines the Android entry point for the Flutter example app by extending `FlutterActivity`, wiring the Flutter engine and activity lifecycle into the host Android project without adding custom platform channels or additional native logic.

## notifly_flutter/example/integration_test
- [App Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/integration_test/app_test.dart): End-to-end integration test that boots the example app, taps the “Get Platform Name” button, and asserts the rendered platform name matches the current OS (Android/iOS), using `IntegrationTestWidgetsFlutterBinding` and `Platform` for environment-specific expectations.
- [App Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/integration_test/app_test.dart): End-to-end integration test that boots the example app, taps the “Get Platform Name” button, and asserts the rendered platform name matches the current OS (Android/iOS), using `IntegrationTestWidgetsFlutterBinding` and `flutter_test` APIs.

## notifly_flutter/example/ios/NotiflyNotificationExtension
- [Notificationservice](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/ios/NotiflyNotificationExtension/NotificationService.swift): NotificationService.swift defines a `NotiflyNotificationServiceExtension` subclass that initializes the Notifly push extension for the iOS notification service target and registers the app with a hardcoded projectId and username during extension startup.
- [Notificationservice](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/ios/NotiflyNotificationExtension/NotificationService.swift): iOS notification service extension example that subclasses `NotiflyNotificationServiceExtension`, initializes on creation, and registers the extension with a hard-coded `projectId` and `username` via `register(projectId:username:)` from the `notifly_sdk_push_extension` dependency.

## notifly_flutter/example/ios/Runner
- [Appdelegate](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/ios/Runner/AppDelegate.swift): iOS Flutter `AppDelegate` integrating `notifly_sdk` by registering Flutter plugins, setting `UNUserNotificationCenter` delegate, and forwarding remote notification registration and `UNUserNotificationCenter` callbacks (`didFailToRegister`, `didRegister`, `didReceive`, `willPresent`) to `Notifly` while preserving superclass behavior.
- [Appdelegate](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/ios/Runner/AppDelegate.swift): iOS Flutter `AppDelegate` integrating `notifly_sdk` by registering plugins, delegating APNs registration callbacks and UNUserNotificationCenter events (`didReceive`, `willPresent`) to `Notifly` while preserving `FlutterAppDelegate` behavior via superclass calls.

## notifly_flutter/example/ios/RunnerTests
- [Runnertests](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/ios/RunnerTests/RunnerTests.swift): Defines the `RunnerTests` XCTestCase scaffold for the iOS example app, providing an entry point to add XCTest-based unit/UI tests for Flutter-integrated Runner code without current test logic or additional dependencies.
- [Runnertests](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/ios/RunnerTests/RunnerTests.swift): Defines an empty `RunnerTests` XCTestCase scaffold for iOS Runner app unit tests, importing Flutter, UIKit, and XCTest, intended as the entry point for adding XCTest-based validation of app and plugin integration.

## notifly_flutter/example/lib
- [Firebase Options](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/lib/firebase_options.dart): Provides the generated `DefaultFirebaseOptions` class exposing `currentPlatform` and platform-specific `FirebaseOptions` (Android/iOS) used by the example app to initialize Firebase via `Firebase.initializeApp`, with unsupported platforms throwing `UnsupportedError`.
- [Main](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/lib/main.dart): Example app entrypoint that initializes Firebase and NotiflyPlugin, configures FCM (foreground/background/terminated handlers) and Android logging, sets up deep/uni-link routing via GoRouter to `HomePage`/`DetailPage`, and wires notification click/deep-link flows.
- [Firebase Options](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/lib/firebase_options.dart): Generated configuration holder exposing `DefaultFirebaseOptions.currentPlatform` and platform-specific `FirebaseOptions` (Android/iOS) for initializing Firebase (`Firebase.
- [Main](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/lib/main.dart): Example app entrypoint wiring Firebase initialization, FCM foreground/background handlers, NotiflyPlugin setup (initialize, log level, permissions, click listener), uni_links deep-link routing via GoRouter (HomePage/DetailPage), and MaterialApp.router bootstrapping.

## notifly_flutter/example/lib/src
- [Homepage](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/lib/src/HomePage.dart): Example app home screen that demonstrates NotiflyPlugin usage: setting user identity/properties, tracking typed event parameters (with optional segmentation) via dynamic key/value inputs, and navigating to arbitrary routes with GoRouter, including UI, validation, and Snackbar feedback.
- [Detailpage](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/lib/src/DetailPage.dart): Stateless Flutter screen that displays a route `id` and uses `GoRouter.of(context).
- [Homepage](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/lib/src/HomePage.dart): Example app home screen that demonstrates NotiflyPlugin usage: managing user identity/email/phone/timezone, setting typed user properties, building dynamic event parameters with optional segmentation keys, tracking events, and navigating via GoRouter using a user-provided route ID.
- [Detailpage](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/lib/src/DetailPage.dart): Stateless Flutter screen that displays a route `id` and uses `go_router` (`GoRouter.of(context).

## notifly_flutter/example/macos/Runner
- [Mainflutterwindow](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/macos/Runner/MainFlutterWindow.swift): Implements the macOS `MainFlutterWindow` that bootstraps the Flutter engine by instantiating `FlutterViewController`, wiring it as the window’s `contentViewController`, preserving window frame, and invoking `RegisterGeneratedPlugins` to register all Flutter plugins.
- [Appdelegate](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/macos/Runner/AppDelegate.swift): Defines the macOS `AppDelegate` entry point by subclassing `FlutterAppDelegate` and configuring the app to terminate when the last window closes, integrating Flutter’s lifecycle into the Cocoa application.
- [Mainflutterwindow](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/macos/Runner/MainFlutterWindow.swift): Defines the macOS `MainFlutterWindow` that initializes a `FlutterViewController`, assigns it as the window’s content, restores the window frame, and invokes `RegisterGeneratedPlugins` to wire up all Flutter plugin registrations on `awakeFromNib()`.
- [Appdelegate](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/macos/Runner/AppDelegate.swift): Defines the macOS app delegate extending `FlutterAppDelegate`, configuring the Flutter runner so the application terminates automatically when the last window closes.

## notifly_flutter/example/macos/RunnerTests
- [Runnertests](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/macos/RunnerTests/RunnerTests.swift): Defines a placeholder `XCTestCase` (`RunnerTests`) for the macOS Flutter runner target, providing a starting point to add XCTest-based integration or UI tests for Runner code without current test logic or additional dependencies.
- [Runnertests](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/macos/RunnerTests/RunnerTests.swift): Defines a placeholder `XCTestCase` (`RunnerTests`) for the macOS Flutter runner target, providing a scaffold to add XCTest-based integration or UI tests for Runner app behavior without introducing any additional logic or dependencies beyond FlutterMacOS and Cocoa.

## notifly_flutter/example/test
- [Widget Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/test/widget_test.dart): Flutter widget test file that bootstraps `MyApp` from `notifly_flutter_example/main.dart` and uses `flutter_test`’s `WidgetTester` to perform a smoke test verifying the counter increments when the `Icons.
- [Widget Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/test/widget_test.dart): Widget test file that boots the example `MyApp`, uses `WidgetTester` from `flutter_test` to simulate tapping the `Icons.add` FAB, and asserts the counter text increments from `0` to `1` as a basic smoke test.

## notifly_flutter/example/test_driver
- [Integration Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/test_driver/integration_test.dart): Entry point for Flutter integration testing that delegates to `integrationDriver()` from `package:integration_test/integration_test_driver.dart`, enabling automated end-to-end test execution for the example app.
- [Integration Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/example/test_driver/integration_test.dart): Provides the entrypoint for Flutter integration tests by delegating `main()` to `integrationDriver()` from `package:integration_test`, enabling automated driver-based execution of the app’s integration_test suite.

## notifly_flutter/lib
- [Notifly Flutter](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/lib/notifly_flutter.dart): Defines the main Notifly Flutter SDK entry point, exposing `NotiflyPlugin` static APIs for initialization, user identity/properties, event tracking, web push permission, Android notification click handling via platform channel callbacks, and platform-specific routing to `NotiflyFlutterPlatform`.
- [Notifly Flutter](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/lib/notifly_flutter.dart): Defines the main Notifly Flutter SDK entrypoint, exposing `NotiflyPlugin` and `getPlatformName()` to initialize the platform interface, manage user identity/properties, track events, request web push permission, configure logging, and register Android notification click listeners via MethodChannel callbacks.

## notifly_flutter/lib/src
- [Utils](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/lib/src/utils.dart): Defines `JSONStringRepresentable`, an abstract interface requiring `jsonRepresentation()` and providing a helper `convertToJsonString` that pretty-prints a `Map<String, dynamic>` as an indented JSON string with escaped newlines and backslashes normalized.
- [Notification](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/lib/src/notification.dart): Defines the `OSNotification` and `OSNotificationClickEvent` models (plus `NotificationClickListener` and `OSNotificationImportance` enum) for representing, parsing, and JSON-serializing Notifly push notifications and click events, including Android-specific metadata and raw payload handling.
- [Utils](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/lib/src/utils.dart): Defines the `JSONStringRepresentable` abstraction for types that expose a `jsonRepresentation()` method and provides a helper `convertToJsonString` using `JsonEncoder.withIndent` to serialize a `Map<String, dynamic>?
- [Notification](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/lib/src/notification.dart): Defines `OSNotification`, `OSNotificationClickEvent`, and `NotificationClickListener` for representing, deserializing, and serializing Notifly notification payloads and click events (including Android-specific importance), relying on `JSONStringRepresentable` and `convertToJsonString` for JSON handling.

## notifly_flutter/test
- [Notifly Flutter Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/test/notifly_flutter_test.dart): Integration test verifying `getPlatformName()` behavior by mocking `NotiflyFlutterPlatform.instance` with `Mocktail`/`MockPlatformInterfaceMixin`, asserting correct platform name propagation and exception throwing when the platform implementation returns null.
- [Notifly Flutter Test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly_flutter/main/notifly_flutter/test/notifly_flutter_test.dart): Unit tests for the `NotiflyFlutter` plugin’s `getPlatformName` API, mocking `NotiflyFlutterPlatform` with `MockPlatformInterfaceMixin` to verify correct platform name resolution and exception behavior when the platform implementation returns `null`.
